channel.title: Timer
channel.description: Hi guys, so I was wondering in [b]java[/b] to find out how to make a timer. So like if I do this... [code=java] public int rightnow = 50; public int whatiwant = 44;[/code] How would I subtract 1 from rightnow for every second that passes by?

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:13, topic:369010”] java.util.Timer timer = new java.util.Timer(); timer.schedule(new java.util.TimerTask() { public void run() { //Do what you need here } }, NUMBER_OF_SECONDS * 1000);[/quote]Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

java.util.Timer timer = new java.util.Timer(); timer.schedule(new java.util.TimerTask() { public void run() { //Do what you need here } }, NUMBER_OF_SECONDS * 1000);

Read full topic

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Well sorry I just told him to fucking try something.

Its not that you were trying to help, its that the way you tried, showed you know absolutely nothing about timers. Timers are not just ints declared with ‘Timer’ in the name. Alot more complicated than something so simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote="† Kane †, post:4, topic:369011"]Just name the int:

Public int RandomTimer = 0;

Change the “Random” to whatever you want.[/quote]
You seriously need to read up on your java. Just go away.

Read full topic

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

is this what u r wanting?

while(rightnow>whatiwant){ rightnow--; sleep(1000); } if this code actually works idk. dont remember if sleep can be called by itself or if u need to specify the thread. but that code is all that would happen–if that code works. idk if you only want it to count down per sec., or do other things while it counts down.

Read full topic

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:6, topic:369010”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=465141.msg3401541#msg3401541 date=1289959988]
Hmmm… http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,449923.msg3300497.html#msg3300497
[/quote]That’s a bit different than what I’m talking about. What I want would be like 6 integers. 3 for the hour, minutes and seconds right now, 3 for the hour, minutes, seconds that will happen in the future. Then the program process’s itself to subtract time and give a message when the 3 “rightnow” integers match the “whatiwant” integers. All I need to know is how to subtract a second when a second passes by. I can do the rest though.[/quote]What? Why would you use that? It would be easier to use a [quote=“Rixxx, post:7, topic:369010”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=465141.msg3401524#msg3401524 date=1289959392]
http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/util/Timer.html
[/quote][/quote]timer, rather than using an integer for all that stuff…

[quote=“Rixxx, post:5, topic:369010”]Hmmm… http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,449923.msg3300497.html#msg3300497[/quote]That’s a bit different than what I’m talking about. What I want would be like 6 integers. 3 for the hour, minutes and seconds right now, 3 for the hour, minutes, seconds that will happen in the future. Then the program process’s itself to subtract time and give a message when the 3 “rightnow” integers match the “whatiwant” integers. All I need to know is how to subtract a second when a second passes by. I can do the rest though.

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:3, topic:369010”]http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/util/Timer.html[/quote]Isn’t there a way like this

if(rightnow <= SOME_SORT_OF_NUMBER && System.currentTimeMillis() - lastAction > actionInterval){ rightnow--; actionInterval = 1000; lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); sM(rightnow); }Got that from my RSPS. That code checks if rightnow is smaller then let’s say “59” and then subtracts 1 and waits 1 second and does it again. Would it work?

Read full topic
